Message.Title: Good News and Bad News for shorts.
Message.Msg: First, Good News: Asian markets mostly lower. Hang Seng down 1.52%. Hong Kong being a former British colony, Hang Seng correlates very well with FTSE which in turn correlates very well with the DOW and S&P500. So the US market is likely to be lower tomorrow. Now, the Bad News: On the other hand, there are groups of people who make money by moving AMZN in the opposite direction of S&P500, so AMZN could go up rather noticeably tomorrow if the general market opens moderately lower.

Message.Msg: All "new eras" end. This "new era" stock is about to deflate massively imho. $175-205 after report is my expectation.
Geegenjar, why do you veer so rapidly from bullish to bearish? You are a pure chart trader?
Sybil, what is your average short price?
Well, AMZN keeps gyrating constantly, no?

Topic.Title: Will this be the quarter when investors run out of patience with Amazon not delivering profits?

Message.Msg: Investors you say ? Speculators and gamblers maybe.
How do you come up with your numbers? Are they from charts?
265 ish

Topic.Title: Will this be the quarter when investors run out of patience with Amazon not delivering profits?

Message.Msg: Soon enough the constant "long-term" view Bezos keeps spewing is going to be viewed as one time to many. Eventually they are going to have to show their cards. I don't think that time is far off...the tell has been spotted and the bluff is identified.
Ex.goldberg: "How do you come up with your numbers? Are they from charts?" No, they are base on our "Half full/half empty" mentality. They (those who move this stock) exploit that to the fullest.

There are many different kinds of traders in this world. I happen to be a short-term momentum trader. I can easily make money if AMZN moves $1.50 or more in the direction favorable to me (usually up because I almost always buy calls). And as you may have noticed AMZN moves up or down many times in a day, often a couple of points in each direction. Why shouldn't I try to benefit from that?
